snippet: Inaction by both the Federal Reserve and the European Central Bank last week had far different effects on the markets.
abstract: Jeff Sommer Strategies column observes inaction by both the Federal Reserve and the European Central Bank in the previous week had far different effects on the markets; notes while financial markets processed the Fed's inaction rather easily, in Europe's case they evidently expected something much more forceful, and stocks fell across the continent and elsewhere.
lead_paragraph: Inaction by both the Federal Reserve and the European Central Bank last week had far different effects on the markets.

headline.print_headline: The Sounds of Two Banks’ Silence
headline.seo: Two Central Banks and the Sound of Silence — Strategies
headline.main: Two Central Banks and the Sound of Silence
